msgSnippet: Looks like a CLASSPATH problem to me. Make sure the class is in your CLASSPATH before you invoke Junit, and that you provide the fully qualified name of the

To: "'junit@yahoogroups.com'" <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Subject: RE: [junit] Class not found
Date: Thu, 10 May 2001 18:12:17 +0100
MIME-Version: 1.0
X-Mailer: Internet Mail Service (5.5.2653.19)
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"
X-eGroups-From: Matt Caswell <matt.caswell@...>
From: Matt Caswell <m.caswell@...>

Looks like a CLASSPATH problem to me. Make sure the class is in your
CLASSPATH before you invoke Junit, and that you provide the fully qualified
name of the class to Junit (i.e. make sure you include the package name,
e.g. com.acme.StringTest)

Matt
